feed.title: Review: Medieval Moves: Deadmund's Quest
feed.subtitle: Medieval Moves: Deadmund's Quest is a first-person action/adventure game that puts you physically in control of the action using the PlayStation Move motion controls.

link.Abstract: Medieval Moves: Deadmund's Quest is a first-person action/adventure game that puts you physically in control of the action using the PlayStation Move motion controls.
link.title: Medieval Moves: Deadmund's Quest is a first-person action/adventure game that puts you physically in control of the action using the PlayStation Move motion controls.

content.div:
Platform: PS3

The Deal: Prince Edmund's castle has been overrun by ruthless wizard Morgrimm and his undead army of skeletons. If our dashing warrior ever hopes to see his kingdom restored to its once-glorious state, he must take up his sword and do battle against the forces of evil or die trying.

"Medieval Moves: Deadmund's Quest" is a first-person action/adventure game that puts you physically in control of the action using the PlayStation Move motion controls. Using this feature makes swinging a sword as easy as swinging the controller. If you want to fire your bow, just simulate pulling an arrow from a quiver, loading it and firing it. The immersion doesn't end with combat. Solving puzzles, drinking potions and launching grappling hooks all function with the Move control, placing you directly in the action.

With its nonstop action, intuitive controls and fun storyline, "Medieval Moves: Deadmund's Quest" brings the adventure directly into your living room and hours of enjoyment to anyone willing to pick up the controller.
